column1:
[1B]C2[1B]P2: Basic Attack[1B]R
Standard attacks that can be chained consecutively. Can also be performed midair.

[1B]C2[1B]P3: Special Attack[1B]R
Character specific actions. Effects vary from simple attacks to ability-enhancing buffs.

[1B]C2[1B]P3: Special Attack from [1B]P2[1B]R
Strong attacks chained from standard attacks. Different moves are performed depending on the number of times [1B]P2 is pressed.

[1B]C2[1B]P3+[1B]P0: Showtime[1B]R
When the Showtime gauge is full, unleash a powerful attack by pressing [1B]P3 and [1B]P0 at the same time.
To progress the story, head towards [1B]C2the area with the [1B]M1~18~ icon[1B]R. By approaching or interacting with the [1B]M1~18~, the story will advance.

[1B]C2[1B]P3: Save[1B]R
You can save your current progress when [1B]C2[1B]P3Save[1B]R
is displayed at the lower-right corner of the screen.

[1B]C2[1B]PK while holding [1B]P4: Persona Skills[1B]R
Hold [1B]P4 and move [1B]PH to aim at enemies, then use skills with [1B]PK. Activating skills will consume HP or SP.

Persona skills have certain [1B]C2affinities[1B]R, while enemies may have [1B]C2weaknesses[1B]R to specific affinities. By using attacks that an enemy is weak against, you will deal greater damage and deplete the enemy's [1B]C2down gauge[1B]R.
Some skills are activated by consuming HP. HP lost through skill use [1B]C2will gradually replenish over time if you do not take damage[1B]R.
[1B]Z
There are some Persona skills that are intended to be used on party members, such as [1B]C2HP recovery[1B]R, [1B]C2buffs[1B]R, and [1B]C2status ailment removal[1B]R skills.

Activate these skills with [1B]P4 then [1B]PK, [1B]C2select a
party member[1B]R with the directional buttons, then
press [1B]PK again to use the skill.

[1B]C2[1B]P0 on downed enemies: All-Out Attacks[1B]R
While an enemy is [1B]C2knocked down[1B]R, press [1B]P0 to initiate an [1B]C2All-Out Attack[1B]R with your teammates.
Since they can deal damage to several enemies at once, it is a good idea to use All-Out Attacks on large groups of enemies.

[1B]C2When an enemy's down gauge is fully depleted[1B]R, it will be knocked down. You can deplete an enemy's down gauge by [1B]C2striking its weaknesses[1B]R or by landing [1B]C2Critical[1B]R and [1B]C2Technical hits[1B]R.

[1B]C2[1B]P0 during on-screen prompt: Phantom Dash[1B]R
Press [1B]P0 to move swiftly. After a phantom dash, you will automatically [1B]C2go into hiding[1B]R.

[1B]C2[1B]P3 while in hiding: Special Actions[1B]R
Depending on the situation, pressing [1B]P3 [1B]C2while in hiding[1B]R will perform different actions, such as attacking or moving.

[1B]C2[1B]PH while in hiding: Switch Targets[1B]R
If you are [1B]C2in hiding[1B]R and there are more points to phantom dash to, you can [1B]C2switch between different target points[1B]R with [1B]PH.

[1B]C2[1B]P5 while moving: Dash[1B]R
While moving in the Metaverse, pressing [1B]P5 will allow you to [1B]C2dash[1B]R.

[1B]C2[1B]PI: Command Menu[1B]R
This menu allows you to check the status of party  members and adjust equipment, among other things.
[1B]C2The upper-right corner of the screen[1B]R displays your [1B]C2current objective[1B]R, as well as a [1B]C2hint[1B]R to help you complete that objective.
Press [1B]C2[1B]PI[1B]R to open the command menu. Consumable items can be used in the [1B]C2Item[1B]R submenu. This can also be done [1B]C2during battles[1B]R.

[1B]C2[1B]P4 while holding [1B]P7: Fire Gun[1B]R
While aiming your gun by holding [1B]P7, you can fire with [1B]P4. Each type of gun has its own [1B]C2ammo stock[1B]R. [1B]C2After a battle ends[1B]R, ammo will [1B]C2replenish[1B]R.
There are [1B]C2several methods of aiming[1B]R which differ by character. Some will lock on to enemies, while others can aim manually.
Certain characters can also [1B]C2change the way they aim[1B]R, or [1B]C2perform special gun attacks[1B]R. Master each character's unique abilities to give yourself an edge in battles.
After battle, a [1B]C2Persona[1B]R may [1B]C2level up[1B]R. Their stats will increase, and they may potentially learn [1B]C2new skills[1B]R.
Some skills [1B]C2activate automatically[1B]R, and [1B]C2do not need to be activated[1B]R by [1B]C2holding [1B]P4 and pressing [1B]PK[1B]R.

Enemies can also use skills. When a [1B]C2skill name appears above an enemy[1B]R, it means they are preparing to use that skill. Use situational awareness to avoid enemy attacks and go on the offensive.
When defeating Shadows that have shown their true forms, a mask may appear. By [1B]C2picking up the mask[1B]R, or by [1B]C2completing the battle[1B]R, you will [1B]C2obtain a new Persona[1B]R.

[1B]C2[1B]PF while holding [1B]P4: Persona Change[1B]R
Joker's infinite potential allows him to carry multiple Personas. He can switch these at will via [1B]C2Persona Change[1B]R.

Switching Personas also [1B]C2switches the skills you can use[1B]R and [1B]C2changes some special attacks[1B]R that you can perform. Observe your enemy and choose the Persona that is most suited to your current battle.

Joker's [1B]C2currently equipped Persona[1B]R will also affect his [1B]C2stats[1B]R and [1B]C2affinities[1B]R. When you become comfortable with switching Personas, keep a mental note of what Persona to have equipped.

[1B]C2[1B]P0 during on-screen prompt: 1 More[1B]R
Foes with larger down gauges won't be knocked down right away. Break a shield icon to create an opening, then press [1B]P0 during the prompt to [1B]C2attack again[1B]R.

[1B]C2[1B]P6: Lock On[1B]R
When you want to prioritize a specific enemy to attack, press [1B]P6 to [1B]C2lock on[1B]R.
Battles will go more smoothly if you focus on enemies with problematic skills or wide attack ranges first.

[1B]C2[1B]PB out of combat in the Metaverse: Auto-Recover[1B]R
When your party members have lost HP, press [1B]PB to activate [1B]C2Auto-Recover[1B]R.

[1B]C2Auto-Recover[1B]R makes use of your party's healing skills to immediately [1B]C2restore HP[1B]R to [1B]C2all party members[1B]R. Be aware that the appropriate amount of SP will still be consumed.
You can check [1B]C2tutorials[1B]R you have seen before and other related information by opening the command menu, navigating to the [1B]C2System[1B]R submenu, then selecting [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R.

[1B]C2[1B]P0: Talking and Examining[1B]R
Approach people and press [1B]P0 to speak to them or listen in on conversations to get information relating to the Monarch.
Intel can also be gathered from sources other than people. [1B]C2Local shops[1B]R may sometimes have valuable information on the Monarch as well.
Open the map with [1B]PJ and select a destination to quickly travel to various points in the city in the real world.
The BOND feature has been unlocked. As the Phantom Thieves deepen their bonds, they will acquire various [1B]C2BOND skills[1B]R.
BOND skills can be purchased with BOND points by navigating to [1B]C2BOND[1B]R on the command menu. BOND points are acquired by [1B]C2raising your BOND level[1B]R.
The BOND level increases through socializing events in the real world, or by fighting battles in the Metaverse.
In the [1B]C2Velvet Room[1B]R, you can [1B]C2fuse[1B]R or [1B]C2strengthen[1B]R your Personas. Visit here and continue to create more powerful Personas.
Fuse [1B]C2a number of the Personas[1B]R you currently have to create [1B]C2a new Persona[1B]R. The Personas used in the fusion will be lost.
In order to fuse a given Persona, Joker's level must be greater than or equal to [1B]C2the new Persona's starting level[1B]R.
For tips on [1B]C2fusing strong Personas[1B]R, please check Fusion Tips in the [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R submenu.
During Persona fusion, it is possible to [1B]C2pass on[1B]R a number of [1B]C2skills[1B]R to the new Persona. Be aware that depending on the Persona, some skills cannot be inherited.
By spending [1B]C2Persona Points[1B]R, you can [1B]C2level up[1B]R your Persona. Be aware that Personas can only be leveled up as far as Joker's current level through this method.
As you progress through the story, you will be able to strengthen your Personas in ways other than leveling them up.
Persona Points are obtained through either [1B]C2picking up the mask of a Persona you are already carrying[1B]R, or through [1B]C2fusing or releasing Personas[1B]R.

Personas that you have obtained will be recorded in the [1B]C2Inmate Registry[1B]R in the Velvet Room. By paying a fee, registered Personas can be summoned with the abilities they had at the time they were registered.
If a Persona is already registered, [1B]C2registering it again[1B]R will overwrite the previous entry with the stats and abilities of the [1B]C2version you are currently carrying[1B]R.

In [1B]C2Sophia's online shop[1B]R, you can buy and sell weapons, protectors, accessories, and items. The shop's inventory increases via story progression, or after certain events. Make sure you're well-stocked before entering a Jail.
There are also shops which sell [1B]C2goods that aren't found online[1B]R. Keep an eye out for good deals as you explore the city.

At the hideout, you can [1B]C2infiltrate the Jail[1B]R, use [1B]C2Sophia's online shop[1B]R, and [1B]C2access the Velvet Room[1B]R. Other features will become available as you progress through the story.
In [1B]C2Change Party[1B]R, you can manage who will join Joker in the Jail. Select up to three teammates who will best fit your party's needs.
You can change your party by opening the command menu and selecting [1B]C2Stats[1B]R. This can be done [1B]C2at any time[1B]R as long as you are [1B]C2outside of combat[1B]R.
At the entrance of the Jail, you can [1B]C2change your party[1B]R, [1B]C2access the Velvet Room[1B]R, and [1B]C2save your game[1B]R, among other things.

[1B]C2Baton Pass: Character switch[1B]R
Perform a Baton Pass with the directional buttons. Passing the baton temporarily boosts the rate that the Showtime gauge increases.

[1B]C2Directional button during prompt: Striker Swap[1B]R
During battle, teammates may propose actions. Press the [1B]C2corresponding directional button[1B]R, and they will [1B]C2Baton Pass[1B]R and perform the action.

[1B]C2[1B]P3 behind an enemy: Ambush[1B]R
Approach an enemy from behind without being detected, then press [1B]P3 to perform an [1B]C2ambush[1B]R.
Performing an [1B]C2ambush[1B]R will give you a [1B]C2preemptive strike[1B]R on the enemy, giving you an advantage at the start of the battle.
Performing an [1B]C2ambush[1B]R will trigger a [1B]C2preemptive strike[1B]R, giving you an advantage at the start of the battle.
However, if you are [1B]C2spotted by an enemy[1B]R, you will be [1B]C2ambushed[1B]R instead, putting you at a disadvantage at the start of the battle.
Among the enemies encountered in the Jail, there may be Shadows that are more powerful than normal enemies. These Shadows will have special names.
Battling powerful Shadows grants higher experience and guarantees that a mask will drop, among other merits.

[1B]C2Hold [1B]P8: Third Eye[1B]R
Hold [1B]P8 to use [1B]C2Third Eye[1B]R, which enables you to see things you wouldn't normally be able to see.
Third Eye can be used to [1B]C2determine enemy strength[1B]R. Strong enemies have a red aura, and weak enemies have a blue aura. Use this information to choose which battles to fight.
BOND is now accessible from the command menu. Spend [1B]C2BOND points[1B]R and obtain BOND skills to enhance the abilities of the Phantom Thieves.
Certain skills are locked by a [1B]C2level cap[1B]R. The conditions for unlocking these level caps will be revealed as you progress through the story.
The Jail is composed of many different areas. Press [1B]PJ to view [1B]C2a map of each area[1B]R. Use these maps to get an understanding of where your objective is.

Be mindful of the [1B]C2security level[1B]R while exploring the
Jail, as raising the security level has a number of
effects. Be aware that if the security level reaches
100%, you will be forced to [1B]C2withdraw from the Jail[1B]R.
You can [1B]C2lower the security level[1B]R by [1B]C2winning battles[1B]R. You can also check the security level by using Third Eye with [1B]P8.

[1B]C2[1B]P3 while in hiding: Ambush[1B]R
After using phantom dash to go into hiding, you can press [1B]P3 to perform an [1B]C2ambush[1B]R.

If the security level is [1B]C2raised past a certain point[1B]R, a barrier will appear around the [1B]C2treasure chests[1B]R in the Jail, [1B]C2preventing them from being opened[1B]R. If the security level is lowered, they can be opened again.

If party members are repeatedly hit by too many attacks, it can result in a [1B]C2knockdown[1B]R. You are more likely to get knocked down if your [1B]C2weakness[1B]R is hit, or if you are struck by a [1B]C2Critical[1B]R or [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R.
You cannot act while you are knocked down. You'll [1B]C2recover faster through movement inputs[1B]R.
Certain things will [1B]C2light up[1B]R when you use [1B]C2Third Eye[1B]R. These usually indicate points which you can [1B]C2phantom dash[1B]R to [1B]C2go into hiding[1B]R.
As you explore the Jail, you will encounter [1B]C2checkpoints[1B]R. Accessing a checkpoint will register it, allowing you to use the [1B]C2same functions that you could at the Jail's entrance[1B]R.
Registering checkpoints also allows you to move [1B]C2freely between them[1B]R, so it is advised to register them whenever possible.
In hacking battles, you must protect Oracle until she completes her hack. [1B]C2If Oracle's HP reaches zero, you will lose[1B]R. Keep an eye on Oracle's HP at the top of the screen.
Hacking battles will [1B]C2progress more smoothly[1B]R if you are able to [1B]C2keep Oracle safe[1B]R.

[1B]C2Preventing enemies from getting close[1B]R, [1B]C2keeping her health high[1B]R, and [1B]C2protecting her with defensive skills[1B]R should all prove effective. Skills that can be used on allies can be used on Oracle by targeting her with [1B]P7.
Oracle is able to equip protectors just like the rest of the Phantom Thieves. In addition to standard female gear, there is also [1B]C2special gear that only Oracle can equip[1B]R.
It is recommended that Oracle have a protector equipped for any future hacking battles that may occur.
Using [1B]C2Third Eye[1B]R can [1B]C2reveal hidden phantom dash[1B]R points, or give you hints on how to find the way forward.

You can [1B]C2escape from a battle[1B]R by continuously running into a [1B]C2blue KEEP OUT barrier[1B]R at the edge of a battle area. However, [1B]C2escape is not possible[1B]R through a [1B]C2red KEEP OUT barrier[1B]R.
Upon [1B]C2successfully escaping[1B]R, the [1B]C2battle will end[1B]R. However, be aware that there are penalties for doing so.
At the hideout, you can use ingredients to [1B]C2cook food[1B]R. These dishes can restore HP and SP or grant buffs, among other powerful effects.

You will be able to [1B]C2cook more dishes[1B]R as you [1B]C2learn recipes[1B]R. You can obtain recipes from [1B]C2regional shops[1B]R or through [1B]C2certain events[1B]R, so make sure to keep an eye out.
[1B]C2Treasure Demons[1B]R are special Shadows that lurk within Jails. If you can defeat one, it will drop a [1B]C2valuable item[1B]R.

When a battle begins, a [1B]C2time limit[1B]R will be displayed. When time runs out, the Treasure Demon will escape. [1B]C2Strike its weakness[1B]R to draw out the main body, then take it down as quickly as possible.

Treasure Demons tend to [1B]C2appear more often[1B]R as you [1B]C2continue exploring or battling[1B]R, or by [1B]C2keeping the security level high[1B]R. Be on the lookout for Treasure Demons as you explore the Metaverse.
You can now enter a Jail in another city. At the hideout, choose [1B]C2Explore Jail[1B]R, then select which Jail to enter. Make use of this in order to level up or explore for treasure.

The [1B]C2Request[1B]R feature has been added. Requests must be [1B]C2accepted[1B]R before they can be completed. To accept requests, go to the [1B]C2hideout[1B]R, then choose [1B]C2View Requests[1B]R.

You will receive requests as you [1B]C2progress through the story[1B]R. This will be indicated by the [1B]C2REQ icon[1B]R on the left side of the screen. Requests can be accepted either [1B]C2at the hideout or through the command menu[1B]R.

After [1B]C2fulfilling the condition of the request[1B]R, report it to [1B]C2complete it[1B]R. Requests can be completed [1B]C2either at the hideout or through the command menu[1B]R. Requests cannot be turned in from inside the Metaverse.
There are two types of requests: Requests that can only be completed once, and those that can be completed multiple times for repeated rewards.
Requests that can be repeated multiple times have [1B]C2a first-time reward and a repeat reward[1B]R. Check the details of the request to confirm the rewards.

Once you choose to go to the next city, you will be [1B]C2unable to return to the city you are currently in[1B]R. Make sure to buy limited items and take care of business that can only be done in that city.

Unlike the cities in the real world, [1B]C2you can revisit past Jails at any time[1B]R. However, be aware that [1B]C2requests obtained from conversing with your friends in past cities[1B]R will [1B]C2no longer be available to accept or complete[1B]R.
Most [1B]C2status ailments[1B]R can be cleansed with [1B]C2items or recovery skills[1B]R. Some ailments can also have their effects [1B]C2shortened[1B]R by [1B]C2movement inputs[1B]R.
[1B]Z

[1B]C2Technical hits[1B]R can be triggered by [1B]C2using the corresponding skills[1B]R on enemies that are inflicted with [1B]C2status ailments[1B]R. They can deal increased damage as well as [1B]C2deplete the down gauge[1B]R.
Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Burn[1B]R will temporarily [1B]C2take damage over time[1B]R. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.
Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Burn[1B]R will temporarily [1B]C2take damage over time[1B]R. [1B]C2Wind and Nuclear[1B]R attacks will trigger a [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R.
Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Freeze[1B]R will become [1B]C2unable to act[1B]R. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.
Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Freeze[1B]R will become [1B]C2unable to act[1B]R. [1B]C2Physical and Nuclear[1B]R attacks will trigger a [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R.
Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Shock[1B]R will [1B]C2have their movement speed reduced[1B]R. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.

Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Shock[1B]R will [1B]C2have their movement speed reduced[1B]R. [1B]C2Physical and Nuclear[1B]R attacks will trigger a [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R. Close-ranged attacks from Shocked enemies have a chance of spreading the ailment.

Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Dizzy[1B]R will [1B]C2have their visibility reduced[1B]R. The effect disappears when you are hit by an enemy attack. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.

Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Dizzy[1B]R will [1B]C2have a chance of missing their attacks[1B]R. [1B]C2Any attack that the enemy does not absorb or nullify[1B]R will trigger a [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R.
Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Forget[1B]R will become [1B]C2unable to use Persona skills[1B]R. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.
Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Forget[1B]R will become [1B]C2unable to use skills[1B]R.

Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Sleep[1B]R will become [1B]C2unable to act[1B]R, but will [1B]C2recover HP and SP[1B]R over time. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.

Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Sleep[1B]R will become [1B]C2unable to act[1B]R, but will [1B]C2recover HP[1B]R over time. [1B]C2Any attack that the enemy does not absorb or nullify[1B]R will trigger a [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R.

Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Fear[1B]R will become [1B]C2unable to act[1B]R, and will be [1B]C2unable to Baton Pass[1B]R. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.
Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Fear[1B]R will become [1B]C2unable to act[1B]R. [1B]C2Psychokinesis[1B]R attacks will trigger a [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R.

Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Rage[1B]R will have their [1B]C2Attack increased and Defense reduced[1B]R, and they will [1B]C2repeatedly use their standard attack[1B]R. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.

Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Rage[1B]R will have their [1B]C2Attack increased and Defense reduced[1B]R, and will [1B]C2only use basic attacks[1B]R. [1B]C2Psychokinesis[1B]R attacks will trigger a [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R.
Party members inflicted with [1B]C2Brainwash[1B]R will [1B]C2attack their teammates[1B]R. This can be cured with [1B]C2Amrita Drop[1B]R, as well as other items and recovery skills.
Enemies inflicted with [1B]C2Brainwash[1B]R will [1B]C2attack their fellow Shadows[1B]R. [1B]C2Psychokinesis[1B]R attacks will trigger a [1B]C2Technical hit[1B]R.
A Persona can remember [1B]C2up to eight skills[1B]R. If it learns another skill and has no room to learn more, it will need to [1B]C2forget a skill[1B]R.
A forgotten skill can be remembered by accessing [1B]C2Persona[1B]R from the command menu. However, skills learned through fusion or other methods of strengthening will disappear if forgotten.

While exploring the Metaverse, you will notice items scattered around. These can vary from [1B]C2junk that can be sold for money[1B]R, to valuable [1B]C2recovery items[1B]R. Make sure to pick up items whenever you see them.
When you are attacked, there is a chance you will [1B]C2automatically evade[1B]R it. The chance of this happening is affected by your Persona's Ag stat.
When you are inflicted with a [1B]C2status ailment[1B]R, your teammates may sometimes [1B]C2cure[1B]R it for you. The chance of this happening can be raised with a BOND skill.
By using Skill Cards, you can [1B]C2make a Persona learn a specific skill[1B]R. Once a skill card is used, it will be lost.
One of Oracle's special support skills. This can grant [1B]C2Kaja-type buffs[1B]R, [1B]C2HP recovery[1B]R, and [1B]C2SP recovery[1B]R, among other beneficial effects.

One of Oracle's special support skills. This can grant [1B]C2a buff to deal over double the damage for Physical attacks[1B]R and [1B]C2increase the rate that the Showtime gauge fills[1B]R, among other beneficial effects.
One of Oracle's special support skills. This can [1B]C2nullify the damage from an attack[1B]R that would [1B]C2KO a party member[1B]R.

When an item goes out of stock, it may need to be [1B]C2resupplied[1B]R. Items like these will [1B]C2restock after enough time passes[1B]R. Try checking back after fighting battles in the Metaverse or progressing through the story.
There are also some items that will cease being sold, and will not be restocked over time.

A certain BOND skill will enable [1B]C2timed sales[1B]R in Sophia's online shop. For a limited time, [1B]C2specific items will be available to purchase at a lower price[1B]R. Make sure to jump on a sale if it's an item you want.

Some treasure chests may [1B]C2restock their contents[1B]R when you [1B]C2infiltrate the Metaverse[1B]R. Be careful not to raise the security level so that you can open as many treasure chests as possible.

Certain chests will be [1B]C2unopenable[1B]R without the [1B]C2lockpicking BOND skill[1B]R. The required lockpicking level differs depending on the chest. If you find a chest you can't open, try raising your lockpicking level first.
A new set of BOND skills have been unlocked. These allow you to [1B]C2strengthen the skills of your Personas[1B]R. Be sure to take advantage of this new power in future battles.
Joker's maximum Persona stock has been increased. You can now carry [1B]C2up to ten[1B]R Personas at one time. Raise a variety of Personas to handle any combat situation.
You can now use triad fusion. Personas born from this fusion are [1B]C2more likely to receive stat bonuses[1B]R. Make use of this whenever you can.
You are now able to strengthen Persona stats. By spending Persona Points, you can increase a Persona's [1B]C2St[1B]R, [1B]C2Ma[1B]R, [1B]C2En[1B]R, [1B]C2Ag[1B]R, and [1B]C2Lu[1B]R.
Zenkichi doesn't have the power to fight Shadows. You must reach the [1B]M1~18~ marker without being detected. [1B]C2If you are spotted, it is game over[1B]R.
[1B]C2Enemies won't spot you while you are in hiding[1B]R. Watch their movements carefully and make use of cover to proceed while avoiding detection.
Requests to defeat powerful enemies have been added. [1B]C2Accept the corresponding request[1B]R, then [1B]C2go to the designated location[1B]R to initiate the battle.
These enemies are immensely powerful, but [1B]C2completing the requests[1B]R will allow you to [1B]C2obtain them as Personas through fusion[1B]R.
You can now use quad and pentad fusions. The Personas born from these fusions possess power of the highest class. Try and fuse them if you have the opportunity.
Welcome to the post-clear game. Your game will continue just before the battle with the Demiurge.

[1B]C2New requests have been added.[1B]R
Try to complete all the requests that have a
"strong reading" and the "Painful Past+"
requests in order to challenge a "terrifying foe."

New Game+ has been unlocked. When you save your
progress for this playthrough, "MASTERED" will be
shown on the save file.

When you load [1B]C2a save file marked with "MASTERED"[1B]R,
you will start from the beginning of the game,
while carrying over certain elements from your
previous playthrough.

There are certain elements that are only available in New Game+. [1B]C2Merciless difficulty is added[1B]R, [1B]C2Lucifer becomes unlocked for fusion[1B]R, and [1B]C2incense can now be purchased from Sophia's online shop[1B]R.
The story will remain unchanged, however [1B]C2Sophie[1B]R will be able to use Pandora from the start, and [1B]C2Wolf[1B]R will immediately be available as a teammate.
Be aware that certain key items and the completion status of requests will not be carried over.

Merciless is a challenging and unforgiving difficulty that [1B]C2can only be selected at the start of New Game+[1B]R. Battle rewards are greatly increased, and extra content is available. There is no additional story content.
If you choose Merciless, [1B]C2you cannot change the difficulty later[1B]R. Think carefully before deciding.

By checking the color of the enemy skill alert, you can determine your affinity towards that skill. [1B]C2White[1B]R indicates [1B]C2regular affinity[1B]R or [1B]C2resistance[1B]R; it is best to simply avoid these attacks.
[1B]C2Red[1B]R indicates a [1B]C2weakness[1B]R to that enemy skill's affinity. These skills will deal heavy damage, and may even knock you down. Be vigilant about avoiding these attacks.
[1B]C2Gray[1B]R means [1B]C2Null[1B]R, and [1B]C2Blue[1B]R indicates [1B]C2Drain[1B]R affinity. You will not take damage from skills of these affinities, so you can safely focus on attacking.
[1B]Z
Teammates who are fighting alongside you may [1B]C2support you[1B]R by using [1B]C2recovery[1B]R or [1B]C2buff[1B]R skills.

[1B]C2[1B]P0 during on-screen prompt: Follow-Up Attack[1B]R
When you hit the enemy with certain attacks, you will be able to [1B]C2follow up[1B]R. This allows you to leap at the enemy and link into a chain of [1B]P2 attacks.
After the midair [1B]P2 attack chain, use a Persona skill with [1B]P3, or hold [1B]P3 to link into a midair special attack.

If you [1B]C2evade an attack with perfect timing[1B]R, you will [1B]C2counterattack that enemy with a skill of your current Persona's affinity[1B]R. Though risky to attempt, you'll get a huge advantage if you can strike your foe's weakness.

[1B]C2The hero with the power of the wild card![1B]R
Joker wields [1B]C2multiple Personas[1B]R, and can [1B]C2swap between
them at will[1B]R. His [1B]C2special attacks change[1B]R depending on
his equipped Persona. See [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of six knife attacks.
[1B]P2[1B]P3: An upward leap combined with an upward slash.
Can be comboed into air attacks.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: A sharp stab attack. Press [1B]P3 again for an additional Persona attack.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Summon Persona for a combo finisher.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: A sweeping slash that may flinch enemies.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: A massive spinning slash.
[1B]P3 or midair [1B]P3: Gunshot.

Master the Persona Change! By switching Personas,
your [1B]C2Persona skills[1B]R, [1B]C2special attacks[1B]R, and even your
[1B]C2weaknesses and resistances[1B]R will change. Use different
Personas to suit your needs.

[1B]C2Charge up, then let 'em have it![1B]R
After Skull's [1B]P2 attacks, special attacks can be charged
by holding [1B]P3. [1B]C2Attack power and range increase as he
charges up[1B]R. See [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of four melee attacks.
[1B]P3: Activates Toughness, which reduces damage taken
and makes you harder to flinch.

[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to charge): Slam attack.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to charge): Full swing. Charging will
increase both damage and launch power.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to charge): Summon Captain Kidd to
use an Electric skill.
[1B]P3 in midair: Execute a dive kick. Press [1B]P3 repeatedly
on hit for more kicks.

Master the art of charge moves! In addition to using
Toughness to tank damage, you can also [1B]C2use [1B]P5 to
evade in the middle of charging[1B]R to avoid attacks.
Your [1B]C2gun attack can be charged[1B]R as well.

Captain Kidd learns many [1B]C2Electric[1B]R and [1B]C2Physical[1B]R skills. Use Electric attacks to inflict [1B]C2Shock[1B]R on your enemies, then switch to [1B]C2Physical[1B]R attacks to score [1B]C2Technical hits[1B]R.

[1B]C2The miraculously fast fighter![1B]R
Mona uses swift movement to unleash a flurry of
special attacks on his foes. He can [1B]C2transform into the
Morgana Car[1B]R with [1B]P3. See [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of five sword attacks.
[1B]P3: Transform into the Morgana Car. It is also possible
to tackle enemies while driving.

[1B]P2[1B]P3: A rising spin slash.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: A punch with high chance of Critical.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Summon Zorro to use a Wind skill.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to extend): An advancing vertical
spin attack. Hold [1B]P3 to extend the distance traveled.

Master a diverse suite of actions! Mona is a versatile
fighter with spin attacks that pull enemies in and a
far-reaching punch attack. [1B]C2Switch between the air and
ground[1B]R to perform varied combos.

Zorro learns many [1B]C2Wind[1B]R skills. These are especially effective at scoring [1B]C2Technical hits[1B]R against [1B]C2burning[1B]R enemies. Pair up with Joker or Panther to inflict large quantities of damage.

[1B]C2Can you handle the heat?[1B]R
Panther's specialty is using a whip, as well as a variety
of Fire attacks. She can also use [1B]C2Enchant to add Fire
affinity to her whip[1B]R. See [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of five whip attacks.
[1B]P2[1B]P3: A scooping whip swing that launches enemies.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Whip slam attack.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Summon Carmen to use a Fire skill.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Twirl the whip, then ignite the ground
with a crack.

[1B]P3: Activates Enchant, which temporarily applies Fire
affinity to the whip.
[1B]P3 during Enchant: Perform a chain of attacks followed
by a blazing Fire attack. Removes Enchant.

Master the use of Enchant! In addition to the standard
[1B]P3, Enchant can also be activated using [1B]C2midair [1B]P3, as
well as [1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3[1B]R. It is important to understand
when to apply and remove Enchant.

Carmen's many [1B]C2Fire[1B]R skills can inflict [1B]C2Burn[1B]R on enemies, making them vulnerable to [1B]C2Technical hits[1B]R from [1B]C2Wind[1B]R skills. Burn your foes with [1B]C2Fire[1B]R skills, then use Baton Pass with Joker or Mona for high-damage combos.

[1B]C2Swift swordplay faster than the naked eye![1B]R
Fox's [1B]P3 unleashes [1B]C2a flurry of slashes[1B]R or protects himself
with [1B]C2counters[1B]R. Time your attacks well to deal heavy
damage. See [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of five sword slashes.
[1B]P2[1B]P3 (press repeatedly): Launching attack.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (press repeatedly): Multi-thrust.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (press repeatedly): After the flurry of slashes,
Goemon uses an Ice skill once sword is sheathed.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: After the counter period, unleash a
wide-sweeping attack.

[1B]P3: Counter. Enter a stance with sword ready, then
counterattack if attacked. An enemy can be further
attacked repeatedly if successful.

Aim for more hits after a successful counter! When
Fox [1B]C2flashes[1B]R during [1B]P3, after midair [1B]P3, or at the end
of [1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3, he [1B]C2can counter attacks[1B]R. If a counter is
triggered, repeatedly attack the enemy for more hits.

Goemon learns many [1B]C2Ice[1B]R and [1B]C2Physical[1B]R skills. Use Ice attacks to inflict [1B]C2Freeze[1B]R on your enemies, then switch to [1B]C2Physical[1B]R attacks to score [1B]C2Technical hits[1B]R.

[1B]C2Go full throttle with Burst![1B]R
Queen's [1B]P3 grants her [1B]C2Burst[1B]R, temporarily applying
[1B]C2Nuclear affinity[1B]R to melee, gun, and special attacks
when riding Johanna. See[1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of six melee attacks.
[1B]P2[1B]P3: A full-body uppercut.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: A front-wheelie slam.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Summon Johanna to use a Nuclear skill.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Drive Johanna and run through enemies.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: An onslaught of punches.

[1B]P3: Burst. Standard and special attacks with Johanna
will temporarily trigger Nuclear affinity explosions.

Master the use of Burst! After activating [1B]C2Burst[1B]R with [1B]P3,
your attacks will trigger [1B]C2additional Nuclear damage[1B]R.
Be mindful of enemies that can resist or even Drain
your Nuclear attacks.

Johanna's [1B]C2Nuclear[1B]R skills can trigger [1B]C2Technical hits[1B]R on enemies that are [1B]C2burning[1B]R, [1B]C2frozen[1B]R, or [1B]C2shocked[1B]R. Team up with Joker, Skull, Panther, or Fox and synergize your attacks.

[1B]C2Elegantly holding down the fort![1B]R
Noir's [1B]P3 attacks can be [1B]C2extended by holding[1B]R [1B]P3.
Look for safe opportunities, then rack up the
damage. See [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of four axe attacks.
[1B]P3 (hold to extend): Summon Milady for an
explosive crossfire.

[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to extend): Downward slice.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to extend): Summon Milady to use a Psychokinesis skill.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to extend): Giant spin attack.

Midair [1B]P3 (hold to extend): Vertical spin attack.
Hold [1B]P3 to link into the downward slice.

Look for opportunities to hold the button! [1B]C2All attacks
can be extended by holding [1B]P3[1B]R. [1B]C2Psychokinesis
skills[1B]R and [1B]C2Gun special attacks[1B]R can also be [1B]C2extended[1B]R.
Capitalize on openings for big damage.

Milady's [1B]C2Psychokinesis[1B]R skills can trigger [1B]C2Technical hits[1B]R on enemies that are inflicted with [1B]C2Fear[1B]R, [1B]C2Rage[1B]R, [1B]C2Brainwash[1B]R, [1B]C2Dizzy[1B]R, or [1B]C2Sleep[1B]R. Milady also learns many [1B]C2Gun skills[1B]R. Make use of the tools available to you.

[1B]C2Perfect Catch and upgrade![1B]R
Press [1B]P2 or [1B]P3 as Sophie's yo-yos come back to perform
a [1B]C2Perfect Catch[1B]R, which will [1B]C2enhance her attacks[1B]R.
See [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of six yo-yo attacks.
[1B]P2[1B]P3: Yo-yo spin trick.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Double loop.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Summon Persona to use a Bless skill.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Send out both yo-yos in a wide spin attack.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3: Launch yo-yos down and ahead, then
summon Persona for additional attack.

[1B]P3: Upgrade. Temporarily increase the power and range
of attacks. Perfect Catches will also trigger an upgrade.

Master performing Perfect Catches! Watch for the
timing [1B]C2when your hands light up[1B]R, then [1B]C2press [1B]P2 or [1B]P3[1B]R
to perform a [1B]C2Perfect Catch[1B]R, which will [1B]C2immediately
raise your attack power[1B]R.

After successfully performing a Perfect Catch, the yo-yos will be temporarily [1B]C2upgraded[1B]R. While they are lit up, their attack power and range will be increased. This upgrade can be applied [1B]C2up to two times[1B]R.
Sophie acquires many [1B]C2Bless[1B]R skills and [1B]C2healing[1B]R abilities. As humanity's companion, she will serve the Phantom Thieves well in both an offensive and support role.

[1B]C2Find the balance between Fury and life drain![1B]R
[1B]P3 activates Wolf's [1B]C2Fury[1B]R. Though powerful, he will [1B]C2lose
HP[1B]R over time. When deactivated, his special attacks
allow him to [1B]C2recover HP[1B]R. See [1B]C2Tutorial[1B]R for more details.

[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2: A chain of four sword attacks.
[1B]P3: Activates/deactivates Fury.

[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to extend): Send out a shockwave.
Hold [1B]P3 to increase power.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (hold to extend): Downward slam.
Hold [1B]P3 for more hits.
[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P2[1B]P3 (press repeatedly): Spinning slash. Press the button repeatedly for more hits. After the attack, Valjean unleashes an Almighty skill as a finisher.

Keep an eye on the damage from Fury! [1B]C2While Fury is
active[1B]R, your attacks will create [1B]C2shockwaves[1B]R and your
[1B]C2speed will increase[1B]R, but you will [1B]C2take damage[1B]R. Watch
your HP and recoup your losses.

Aiming your guns will deactivate Fury. Your [1B]C2gun attacks can drain HP as well[1B]R. In addition, aiming and [1B]C2holding [1B]P4[1B]R will unleash a barrage of bullets in all directions. Use different attacks to suit different situations.

Valjean learns many [1B]C2Almighty[1B]R and [1B]C2Gun[1B]R skills, as well as [1B]C2buffing[1B]R skills. His strength becomes more pronounced when he is in control of the battle. Show those kids how a real adult handles things.
When you fully deplete the down gauge of a [1B]C2powerful enemy[1B]R, it will trigger a [1B]C2special All-Out Attack[1B]R. This provides an opportunity to deal significant damage.
If you are already carrying the maximum number of Personas, and you obtain a Persona you have never held previously, the Persona will be [1B]C2automatically entered into the Inmate Registry[1B]R.
Personas obtained in this manner will [1B]C2not require a fee on their first summoning from the registry[1B]R. Take advantage of this service when you have room to carry more Personas.
Each character has their own unique set of skills known as [1B]C2Master Arts[1B]R. By [1B]C2using that character[1B]R, they will gradually learn these abilities.
As a character learns Master Arts, their capabilities in battle will expand. Check each character's details under [1B]C2Stats[1B]R for more information.

On Merciless difficulty, you will be [1B]C2unable to select
"Retry battle"[1B]R after losing in battle.

The only available options will be "Return to start
of infiltration" (or checkpoint), or "Return to Title."
Remember to approach battles with caution on
Merciless difficulty.
You can now use Analysis. [1B]C2Enemy information will be displayed[1B]R while summoning a Persona with [1B]P4, by using Third Eye with [1B]P8, or when Oracle performs a scan.
Analysis allows you to confirm a Shadow's [1B]C2weaknesses[1B]R and [1B]C2resistances[1B]R, as well as [1B]C2whether or not they have a chance of dropping a mask[1B]R, among other useful data.
Some [1B]C2cooking recipes[1B]R can be sold in local shops. Don't miss the opportunity to buy them whenever you find them.
If you miss out on any recipes, [1B]C2it is still possible to buy them from Sophia's online shop[1B]R. However, be aware that obtaining them this way will be much more expensive.
During Persona fusion, there is a rare chance of fusing [1B]C2a different Persona than the one that was expected[1B]R.
Personas born from fusion accidents are [1B]C2more likely to receive stat bonuses[1B]R, so they may start out fairly strong.
Some requests can be added by speaking to [1B]C2your teammates in the Phantom Thieves[1B]R. Try talking to your friends if you run into them while exploring a city.
When Oracle takes damage, she can be healed with [1B]C2Persona skills or recovery items[1B]R. Keep an eye on her HP to ensure it doesn't get too low.
Personas born from fusion may receive [1B]C2stat bonuses[1B]R. These Personas will be [1B]C2stronger than the ones you can pick up from battles[1B]R, so make use of fusion as much as possible.

A Persona is more likely to receive stat bonuses when you fuse [1B]C2a Persona that has been repeatedly used in fusion[1B]R. The [1B]C2more fusions it has been through[1B]R, the higher the chance for stat bonuses.

The [1B]C2Inmate Registry[1B]R keeps track of Personas that
have been repeatedly used in fusion, so you can
easily summon them back to fuse strong Personas
with stat bonuses.

[1B]C2Personas whose stats have been boosted via spending Persona Points[1B]R will also be more likely to grant stat bonuses when they are used in fusion. This is another method to fuse powerful Personas with stronger stats.

The difficulty level of battles can be changed on the title screen, or by navigating to [1B]C2Config[1B]R, which is found under [1B]C2System[1B]R in the command menu. [1B]C2The difficulty level can be changed at any time[1B]R.

Easy: Allows you to comfortably enjoy battles.
Normal: Allows you to enjoy a moderate challenge.
Hard: For advanced players who are familiar with action games.

You can return to the real world from either the [1B]C2Jail entrance[1B]R, or through a [1B]C2checkpoint[1B]R. Returning to the real world will [1B]C2restore all HP and SP[1B]R, and resets the security level back to 0%.
There are [1B]C2no downsides[1B]R to leaving the Jail. If you are exhausted from battling, or the security level is too high, retreating is a very viable option.

Certain enemies will emit a bluish-white light. These foes are known as [1B]C2Dire Shadows[1B]R, and are [1B]C2much more powerful[1B]R than average enemies. Only challenge these behemoths if you are confident in your fighting skills.
